text: The only situation where \( m^3 \equiv 1 \pmod{3} \) is when \( m \equiv 1 \pmod{3} \).
class-1-reason: This paragraph concludes that m must be of the form m ≡ 1 (mod 3) based on the exploration in the previous paragraph, which is a direct consequence of the explored possibilities. This builds on the previous analysis, advancing the understanding of the problem's constraints.
class-2-reason: Analyzing the results of the modular arithmetic to determine when m^3 is congruent to 1 modulo 3.

text: This means \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \equiv 1 \pmod{2} \), implying that any integer cube \( m^3 \) is odd.

class-2-reason: Concluding that the expression is congruent to 1 modulo 2, implying that any integer cube m^3 is odd.
